javadoc:
Used by {@link Field}s to combine text, attributes and location information (for example to and 
 from screen and data locations).  FieldFactory classes can use the various implementations
 of this interface, or create new ones, to include additional information specific to the fields
 that they create.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the text contained by this field element.
@return the text contained by this field element.
methods.name: getText
methods.comment: Returns the text contained by this field element.

return.comment: the text contained by this field element.

methods.name: length
methods.comment:
Returns the length of the text within this element.  This is a convenience method for 
 calling getText().length().

return.comment: the length of the text within this element.

methods.name: getStringWidth
methods.comment:
Returns the string width of this element.  The width is based upon the associated 
 FontMetrics object within this element.

return.comment: the string width of this element.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the amount of height above the baseline of this element.
@return the amount of height above the baseline of this element.
methods.name: getHeightAbove
methods.comment: Returns the amount of height above the baseline of this element.

return.comment: the amount of height above the baseline of this element.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the amount of height below the baseline of this element.
@return the amount of height below the baseline of this element.
methods.name: getHeightBelow
methods.comment: Returns the amount of height below the baseline of this element.

return.comment: the amount of height below the baseline of this element.

methods.name: charAt
methods.comment: Returns the character at the given index.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index of the character in this field element.

return.comment: the character at the given index.

methods.name: getColor
methods.comment:
Returns the color for a given character within this element, since different colors may be
 applied to different characters.

return.comment: the color for a given character within this element.

methods.name: substring
methods.comment: Returns a new FieldElement containing just the characters beginning at the given index.

params.name: start
params.comment: The starting index (inclusive) from which to substring this element.

return.comment: a new FieldElement containing just the characters beginning at the given index.

methods.name: substring
methods.comment:
Returns a new FieldElement containing just the characters beginning at the given start 
 index (inclusive) and ending at the given end index (exclusive).

params.name: start
params.comment: The starting index (inclusive) from which to substring this element.

params.name: end
params.comment: The end index (exclusive) to which the substring will be performed.

return.comment: a new FieldElement containing just the characters beginning at the given index.

methods.name: replaceAll
methods.comment:
Returns a new FieldElement with all occurrences of the target characters replaced with the 
 given replacement character.

params.name: targets
params.comment: The array of characters to replace.

return.comment:
a new FieldElement with all occurrences of the target characters replaced with the 
 given replacement character.

methods.name: getMaxCharactersForWidth
methods.comment:
As the name implies, this method returns the maximum number of characters from this field
 element that will fit within the given width.

return.comment:
the maximum number of characters from this field element that will fit within 
 the given width.

methods.name: getDataLocationForCharacterIndex
methods.comment:
Translates the given character index to a data location related to the data model, as 
 determined by the FieldFactory.

return.comment: The data location in the model coordinates.

methods.name: getCharacterIndexForDataLocation
methods.comment: Returns the character index appropriate for the given data location

params.name: dataRow
params.comment: the row in the data model as determined by the creating field factory.

params.name: dataColumn
params.comment: the column in the data model as determined by the creating field factory.

return.comment: the character index appropriate for the given data location

methods.name: paint
methods.comment:
Paints the text contained in this field element at the given x,y screen coordinate using the
 given Graphics object.

params.name: g
params.comment: the Graphics object used to paint the field text.

params.name: x
params.comment: the horizontal screen position to paint

params.name: y
params.comment: the vertical screen position to paint.

methods.name: getFieldElement
methods.comment: Returns the inner-most FieldElement inside this field element at the given location

return.comment: the inner-most FieldElement inside this field element at the given location

name: FieldElement
comment:
Used by Fields to combine text, attributes and location information (for example to and 
 from screen and data locations).  FieldFactory classes can use the various implementations
 of this interface, or create new ones, to include additional information specific to the fields
 that they create.
